-To train our Atfal Amila Members and Naibeen on how to hold an Atfal class, I (Nazim Atfal Noor) devoted this month to guiding some of our Atfal Amila members in organizing and leading the Atfal classes. This attempt was very succesful and benefical. I will continue working on this in the remaining months with the intention of having every amila member lead at least one atfal class.

- Secretary Taleem, Arhum Ahmed, and Naib Nazim Atfal, Amir Nomani, held an Eid ul Adha Zoom atfal class. The class started with an Eid-ul-Adha themed word search, then a presentation on the significance of Eid ul Adha and it’s background, followed by a Kahoot quizzing Atfal on Hajj and Eid. Nazim Atfal Noor also discussed the Islamic Calendar and it’s connection to the moon. He also discussed the month of Dhul Hijjah and resources for Atfal on how they can learn more about Hajj. For example, how they can search Makkah Live on YouTube and see Pilgrims doing Hajj in real time as well as Vlogs of people documenting their Hajj experience. 

- Secretary Khidmat e Khalq, Yousuf Ahmad, and Naib Nazim Atfal, Fozaan Noor, lead a Zoom Atfal class focused on teaching Atfal about Khidmat e Khalq. The class started with an exercise session and then the fun Khidmat e Khalq Daily service to Allah’s creation challenge activity where Atfal completed 10 khidmat e khalq related tasks together. In class, Nazim Atfal Noor screenshared an Alislam article with Atfal on the month of "Muharam" and how Hazoor (aba) has advised everyone to say Durood in this month.

- Secretary Tarbiyyat, Arhum Farooq, and Naib Nazim Atfal, Rehan Khan, created an excellent Friday sermon time stamp document. This document lists out all of the timestamps where Atfal can find the answers to the Friday Sermon quiz by wathcing Hazoor (aba)'s sermon.

- Our Waqar e Amal for this month was a Pre-Eid Setup where our Atfal helped move and setup tables, chairs, rugs, and more.

- A strong push was made to encourage Atfal to attend national ijtema. Flyers were printed and posted in Mens' and Ladys' side of the Masjid. Jummah Announcements were also made at all Mosques and Salat Centers. An ijtema flyer slide was also projected on the Masjid's TV at the lobby. Phone calls and personal messages also made by Naibeen and myself (Nazim Atfal Noor).

- Secretary Ishaat, Israr Mahmud, researched all the costs to print colored fliers and posters. He ordered them, picked them up, and helped tape them. 

- Secretary Maal, Sultan Rahman, reminded Atfal about Chanda and collected it at Jummahs. 

- Shared topics that Atfal can write about for Al Bashir. Nazim Atfal Noor also proofread one tifls article and provided spelling and grammatical edits to it. The tifl submitted the article.
 
- Shared trailer on the Stories of the Prophets with atfal. 

- We split the Atfal Tajneed amongst the naibeen so they can contact their parents to establish relationships. This was also used this to inform everyone about ijtema. 

- We are currently planning on holding monthly food drives

Atfal first played a Kahoot quiz, and then the New Year's Resolution presentation was shared and Atfal each shared their resolutions with one another. The final session was led by Murabbi Atfal sahb who gave a presentation about the importance of Atfal identity as truthful, kind, and God-fearing Muslims. The event was then concluded with silent prayer and Qaid Sahb encouraged Atfal to pray Nawafil prayers for the new year.

We commenced with Tilawat and Atfal pledge. We then proceeded with Amila member introductions. Murrabi Atfal sahib introduced himself first, followed by naibeen, and then the secretary postions. Then I provided a brief explanation of the Atfal Amila and what to expect in the coming year.

We had two virtual sporting activites this month. The first was held in the beginning of December 5th's virtual Atfal class where Naib Nazim Atfal Huud Ahmad lead a 5ish minute exercise session. We also held an exercise session in the middle of the New Years Eve Virtual meetup class to get Atfal ready and energized for the upcoming Jeopardy.
We need to add Atfal from San Diego Halqa into our LA Atfal tajneed. We also need to remove some young Khudam that are appearing on our LA Atfal tajneed.

- December 5th Atfal class: started with a 5 min workout in the beginning of class. Then we watched a video highlighting a story about a flood in Australia and the power of prayers. An intractive discussion followed where Atfal shared their experiences of experiencing God and of their prayers being accepted. 

- December 12th Atfal class: We continued the discussion on prayers from last week and watched a video about searching God. For the Discussion I asked them what their goals are and how they will achieve those goals. Then I proceeded to share with them that we should also pray to achieve our goals. Also how we all put in immense effort to reach our goals, and similarly we should also put in immesne effort to strengthen our relationship with Allah. 

- December 31st: New Years Eve virtual meetup atfal class/event. We had a pre-meetup I-Spy game while Atfal joined the session. We formally commenced with tilawat from Ramish Ayyan, a tifl from San Diego Halqa. Atfal pledge followed. LA Atfal took a stroll down Singapore through a virtual field trip and learned about Chinese New Year and the importance of sticking to their identity. We transitioned into an energizing workout by LA Atfal Secretary Sehet e Jasmani, Jasim Malik, to get pumped for a competitive game of Jeopardy. LA Atfal were split into teams and collaborated in breakout rooms to answer a variety of Jeopardy questions relating to the Basics of Islam, Attributes of Allah, Basics of Ahmadiyya, Islamic History, and how to spend the New Years. We also watched a video where Hazrat Mirza Tahir Ahmad shared his experience on how he prayed nawafil on New Years Eve. There was a neck and neck competition in the Jeopardy. We concluded by sharing announcments and with Dua. 

-On November 14th we did have Atfal particpate in waqar e Amal, but I forgot to include in November's report. There were a Few Atfal who had helped setup for the Existence of God session by putting up chairs. A few Atfal also helped clean up and move furniture/chairs after the session.

The team consisted of myself (Noor Mohammed), Naib Nazim Atfal Rehan Khan, Naib Nazim Atfal Amir Nomani, and atfal Secretary Waqfe e Jadid Sharif Chaudhry. - There were 3 waqar e amal activites held. One was held after Tahir Acadamy class where Atfal packed up the classrooms and helped tidy up the place. The second was held during Atfal class where Atfal setup chairs for the class in the beginning, and at the end of class they broke down the chairs and placed them in their initial spot. The third was held on the day of the Khudam mulaqat where a few Atfal stacked up and moved many charis in the Lajna hall when wrapping up the Mulaqat arrangements

- Our first In-person Atfal class was held. Atfal particpated in ice-breaker activities among smaller groups so they could catch-up and strengthen their brotherhood.There was only one held due to many jamaat and other events happening the other sundays. For example, the khudam mulaqat on Sunday cancelled Tahir Academy, along with the Jamaat Elections and Hazrat Masih Maud Day being on the same day as tahir Academy and Atfal class. Thus, we cancelled Atfal class and were only able to hold one Atfal class. 

- We are working with the Khudam sehet e jasmani secretary to have Atfal particpate in Cricket tutorial classes. 

- A strong push for Atfal Mulaqat attendance was made. Also helped with the logisitcal components of the LA Atfal mulaqat and in other areas. 

-Sold the Hazrat Adam story books to Atfal and are continuing to do so.

- Although not organized, many Atfal participated in Sehet e Jasmani by playing basketball during lunch and on Sundays. 

- Atfal tajneed secretary made a google form to collect tajneed information and has been using it to collect and update Atfal tajneed. He has also been contacting parents for their emails for those Atfal that we do not have any email on record. 

- Atfal Ishaat Secretary is working on creating flyers and tracker sheets that we can print and hand out to Atfal every Atfal class so they can stay ontop of all our fun challenges and activites. The plan is to have Atfal bring their completed checklists to recieve a prize.

- Atfal Taleem secretary and I discussed holding Atfal classes in other locations as Atfal classes are predominantly in person now. We are working on creating a hybrid form of class for those that are unable to attend in person due to health reasons or live too far away. 

- Atfal Umoomi has been activiely reminding Atfal amila of meetings, taking minutes, sending emails, and google invites. 

-Atfal Khidmat e Khalq secretary encouraged Atfal to particpate in Khidmat e Khalq Daily service to Allah's creation challenge.
